intro: [WRONG START] Erysimony rhodium, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that often appear in clusters, and its lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. Erysimum rhodium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in garden settings.
